channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI is gobbling our personal data—but new advances in blockchain can stop that
item.description: Blockchain's growing ability to verify our identity and actions mean we don't have to rely on corporate AI tools.

item.title: Private credit: what critics miss and what founders need to know
item.description: The critiques of private credit too often focus on headlines and hypotheticals, rather than on structure, incentives, and outcomes.

item.title: Meta is hiring entry-level roles that pay up to $290,000 a year and require little prior experience
item.description: The $1.8 trillion tech giant is looking for software engineers, only requiring a bachelor’s degree and minimal working experience. They’re welcome job...

item.title: Jamie Dimon calls Zohran Mamdani’s movement ‘more Marxist than socialist,’ but he’s offering his help: ‘Get involved and grow up’
item.description: The JPMorgan CEO Said "it is odd to have the bastion of American capitalism with a socialist" looking likely to govern, but "capitalism has a lot to f...

item.title: Job hugging. Quiet cracking. Rage applying. Are these buzzwords helping — or hurting — the workplace?
item.description: I'm Aflac's head of HR and worked in the industry for over two decades, and I've never seen workplace terminology evolve this quickly.
